intro: Euphorbia graminea, commonly known as the leafless euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique appearance, featuring a thick, fleshy stem covered in small, greenish-yellow bracts that resemble leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
